alternative_title: Find out if you can get compensation if you're a victim of crime abroad, and how to apply
body:
$!If you're a UK resident and have been injured because of a violent crime in another country, you can usually apply for compensation.$!

The rules are different depending on whether the crime happened in an EU country or one outside the EU.

##If the crime happened in an EU country

Contact the EU Compensation Assistance Team to apply for compensation.

$C **EU Compensation Assistance Team**  
<eucat@cica.gsi.gov.uk>  
0300 003 3601  
Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm  
Wednesdays, 10am to 5pm
$C

##If the crime happened in a country outside the EU

Not all countries outside the EU have a compensation scheme. You have to apply directly to the country where the crime happened.

Contact the [British embassy](http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/travel-and-living-abroad/find-an-embassy/ "Find an embassy"){:rel="external"} for help.

*[EU]: European Union
